thread.title: Could Baltimore get its own Caribbean-style lagoon?
thread.title_full: Could Baltimore get its own Caribbean-style lagoon?

author: Melody Simmons
title: Could Baltimore get its own Caribbean-style lagoon?
text: A Crystal Lagoon in Chile. Could Baltimore soon be in line for a 7-acre, Caribbean-style blue lagoon? Talks are underway to construct such a resort complete with a sandy beach, a curving shoreline of tropical blue waters, palm trees and kayaks, said Uri Man , CEO of Crystal Lagoons, a Florida-based developer of lagoons. 2 photos A Crystal Lagoon in Chile. Man was in Baltimore Wednesday, but declined to name the developer or the location for the possible lagoon. But he said a decision could be forthcoming in the next six months. "It would be used for all the wonderful activities in the summer," Man said, of the local lagoon's capacity for kayaking, paddle boarding and even sailing. "The developer feels like itâ€™s going to be a key element for their development." Crystal Lagoons is planning a landmark-like lagoon for the Wynn resort in Las Vegas, Man said. That one will stretch 38 acres and is to be located on portion of what is now a golf course near the hotel complex. Man said the Baltimore lagoon could have a winter option of a possible skating rink. The developer, he said, is considering selling $25 day passes to the general public and even a seasonal "beach pass" for summer-long usage. "It's all about enjoyment of the beach life," he said. Crystal Lagoons lists on its website more than 600 projects in different stages of planning, design, construction or operation in 60 countries. The company recently broke ground on lagoons in Tampa, Fla., and Texas. Melody covers real estate and economic development. Industries
